title: Task 1: Attribute a work of art to a specific artist, culture, art-historical style, or object type.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately attribute the work shown to the specific African culture in which it was created.
Response accurately attributes the work shown to the specific African culture in which it was created.

title: Task 2: Accurately uses specific visual evidence to justify the attribution by explaining similarities with work by a specific artist, culture, art-historical style, or object type represented in the image set.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately use any examples of specific VISUAL evidence to justify the attribution by describing relevant similarities between the work shown and other work of the same type created by the same African culture.

Response accurately uses ONE example of specific of specific VISUAL evidence to justify the attribution by describing relevant similarities between the work shown and other work of the same type created by the same African culture.

Response accurately uses TWO examples of specific of specific VISUAL evidence to justify the attribution by describing relevant similarities between the work shown and other work of the same type created by the same African culture.

title: Task 3: Explain how the possible intent, purpose, and/or function shape the creation or meaning of a work of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT use specific CONTEXTUAL evidence to explain the function of this type of work.
Accurately uses ONE example of specific CONTEXTUAL evidence to explain the function of this type of work.

title: Task 4: Explain how and/or why context influences artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, and/or function in the creation or meaning of a work of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately use specific CONTEXTUAL evidence to explain how the function influenced either the form OR the content of this type of work.
Response accurately uses specific CONTEXTUAL evidence to explain how the function influenced either the form OR the content of this type of work.
